column1: preside  over  a  criminal  trial  merely  to  see  that  a  no  innocent  man  is
punished. A judge also presides to see that a guilty man does not escape.
One is as important as the other. Both are public duties.‚Äù
As such upon considering the submissions of both sides we are of the opinion
that  there  is  evidence  to  say  that  the  appellant  has  caused  the  death  of  the
deceased in a very gruesome manner and thereafter the telemarks at the scene
of crime had further implicated him for the charge in the indictment.
As such we have to conclude that the valiant effort of the appellant in denying
any involvement had not created any doubt in the story for the prosecution and
the trial judge had been correct in concluding that he is guilty for the charge in
Hence, we see no merit in the submissions of the Counsel for the appellant as
such we dismiss the instant appeal.
